educational_objective: Diagnose Graves disease based on a thyroid scan.
question_text: A 30-year-old woman with confirmed hyperthyroidism is further evaluated with radioactive iodine uptake and scan showing 38% uptake.Thyroid scan is shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: The most likely diagnosis is Graves disease (Option A). Radioiodine uptake is elevated in Graves disease (>30%), and this patient's thyroid scan shows diffuse uptake, consistent with the diagnosis of Graves hyperthyroidism. Graves disease is characterized by a diffusely hyperactive thyroid gland with resultant excess thyroid hormone production and subsequent suppression of thyroid-stimulating hormone secretion by the pituitary gland.
